Class AssociationAndOwnership

Namespace
NDSH.Geospatial.Gml
Assembly
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.ISO19115.Ed2003.dll

Represents a generalized association in GML, providing an XLink-based mechanism for referencing external or internal resources within geospatial metadata. This abstract class implements the GML AssociationAttributeGroup pattern from gmlBase.xsd, enabling a standard approach for linking GML objects and facilitating interoperability with ISO 19115:2003 metadata structures.

Encoding a GML property in-line vs by-reference shall not imply anything about the “ownership” of the contained or referenced GML Object, i.e. the encoding style shall not imply any “deep-copy” or “deep-delete” semantics.To express ownership over the contained or referenced GML Object, the gml:OwnershipAttributeGroup attribute group may be added to object-valued property elements.If the attribute group is not part of the content model of such a property element, then the value may not be “owned”. When the value of the owns attribute is true, the existence of in-line or referenced object(s) depends upon the existence of the parent object. 

[IsoType("AssociationAttributeGroup,OwnershipAttributeGroup", IsoType = IsoTypes.AttributeGroup)]
public abstract class AssociationAndOwnership : AssociationEntity, IModel, IObservableModel, INotifyPropertyChanged, IDbId, IAssociation, ISimpleLink, IType, IHref, IRole, IArcRole, ITitle, IShow, IActuate, INilReason, ITypeMetadata, IRemoteSchema, IOwnership

Remarks

In practice, GML uses “association” elements or properties to capture relationships between metadata objects or geospatial features—often expressed through the xlink attributes (href, role, arcrole, title, show, and actuate). By abstracting these attributes into a single class, Association enables a consistent mechanism for referencing remote or local resources.

The class also supports a nilReason attribute (based on GML’s NilReasonType) to indicate missing or inapplicable data, reflecting the requirements of ISO 19115:2003 for managing incomplete or unknown metadata values. Additionally, a remoteSchema attribute is provided to reference an external schema, though it is marked as deprecated in GML.

In ISO 19115 applications, leveraging this association pattern can help decompose or link metadata elements effectively, fostering modular metadata design and allowing distributed systems to reference shared resources rather than duplicating content.

Properties

Owns

Gets/Sets a bool value indicating whether the existence of the contained or referenced GML object depends on the existence of the parent object.

public bool Owns { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

A bool value representing ownership semantics. The default value is false.

Remarks

The owns attribute, as defined in the gml:OwnershipAttributeGroup, specifies whether the parent object holds ownership over the contained or referenced GML object.

  • If set to true, the life-cycle of the contained or referenced object is tied to the parent object, meaning that if the parent object is deleted, the owned object(s) should also be deleted.
  • If set to false (default), the contained or referenced object exists independently of the parent.
This attribute does not imply any specific encoding style (in-line vs. by-reference).
